46:00 Caption: The match has reached half-time.
46:59 Caption: We have been witnesses to an ordinary game without many breathtaking situations, but there is still time for improvement in the second half. The host team has dominated the game in almost all aspects so far and their opponents have struggled to keep up. The tactic of the home side is slow build-up play and the away side is creating their opportunities using lightning-fast counter-attacks.

47:15 Caption: That's all for today as the game is over.
47:59 Caption: There was no time for the supporters to get bored during the game as it was full of action and thrilling moments. Great display from the home side, you have to say that they were the better side today. The home side attempted to hold onto the ball for as long as possible, while the away side focused on defending and let the opposition keep possession.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
In a highly anticipated Serie A fixture, Napoli hosted AC Milan at the Stadio San Paolo. From the outset, the game promised high drama and delivered it in spades, culminating in a decisive 3-0 victory for the hosts. The match commenced with Napoli taking the kick-off, a prelude to a night filled with relentless football action.

Just 40 seconds into the game, the first incident of note occurred when an AC Milan player committed a foul. This early clash of tempers set the stage for an intense rivalry. Only moments later, disaster struck for AC Milan as they were reduced to ten men with a red card being issued.

Napoli capitalized quickly on their numerical advantage. At the 2:59 mark, they fired a shot on target, leading to a penalty. Although the immediate follow-up from the penalty didn't convert, the onslaught on AC Milan's goal was continuous. Within minutes, Napoli unleashed a barrage of shots and corner kicks. They came remarkably close on multiple occasions, with Marek Hamsik and Lorenzo Insigne being particularly prominent in driving the attacking play.

Despite being a player down, AC Milan tried to mount some resistance. Giacomo Bonaventura took a shot at the 12:19 mark, which was comfortably saved by Mariano Andujar. Another pivotal moment came when AC Milan earned a corner, but Keisuke Honda's delivery failed to break the Napoli defense.

There's no denying that the early stages of the first half were dominated by Naples. They continually pressed forward, forcing AC Milan to defend desperately. Marek Hamsik attempted long-range shots, only to miss the target. Insigne was another key player who missed narrowly after receiving precise passes.

One of the notable defensive efforts came when an intervention stopped a dangerous Napoli cross. However, Napoli kept the pressure relentless, forcing AC Milan to frequently clear the ball or concede corners, one of which led to another significant opportunity for Hamsik, who missed narrowly wide.

AC Milan's tenacity in defense saw them occasionally regain possession and attempt counter-attacks. Bonaventura’s noteworthy moment came when he latched onto a cross and hit the post with a header at the 38:00 mark, which could have been a crucial turning point in the game. However, their efforts were often thwarted by an alert Napoli defense.

As the clock neared half-time, Napoli continued to dominate possession and pummel the Milan defense with repeat attempts. Cris Maggio and Gonzalo Higuain added their weight to the offensive, with Higuain coming particularly close to scoring with shots that flew just wide or over the bar. By half-time, the score remained 0-0, but the lopsided nature of the match in favor of Napoli was evident.

The second half resumed with AC Milan taking the kickoff. Almost instantly, Napoli recommenced their siege on the Milan goal. Jose Callejon had a shot blocked, leading to a corner just seconds into the half. This summed up the nature of the game as Milan were consistently on the back foot.

Napoli's persistent efforts finally bore fruit and set the crowd roaring. At the 24:33 mark, Hamsik's perseverance paid off as he smashed an unstoppable shot in off the right post to make the score 1-0. Celebrations erupted but were momentarily dampened when Hamsik earned a yellow card, possibly for his exuberant celebration. Nevertheless, the game's flow continued to favor Napoli.

Their second goal was nothing short of brilliance. Gonzalo Higuain, ever the predator, received a precise pass by Dries Mertens inside the box and placed the ball into the right side of the net, doubling Napoli's lead at the 28:36 mark. Higuain almost added a third immediately but his effort was saved, only for the ball to land kindly to Manolo Gabbiadini who fired home from close range to make it 3-0 at the 30:30 mark, finalizing an impressive couple of minutes.

As AC Milan struggled to keep up, substitutions were made. Mattia Destro and Salvatore Bocchetti made way for Giampaolo Pazzini and Daniele Bonera, an attempt to inject fresh energy into the beleaguered squad. However, these changes did little to stem the tide as Napoli continued to press their advantage.

Throughout the closing stages, Napoli remained dominant. They consistently forced AC Milan back into their defensive third, intercepting passes and thwarting any attempt at mounting a comeback. With precise and decisive play, Napoli might have added more goals if not for some stoic goalkeeping by Diego Lopez, who made several excellent saves.

Defending against wave after wave of Napoli's attacks, AC Milan showed moments of resistance. There were occasional fouls and free kicks awarded to AC Milan, but none of these moments translated into significant threats on the Napoli goal.

With the match drawing to a close, AC Milan's fate was sealed. Higuain's flair and ability to create chances ensured that Napoli never looked off balance. Marek Hamsik remained integral throughout, combining with Insigne and Callejon to maintain the attacking pressure. In a final twist, Dries Mertens had a chance to score from a free kick but narrowly missed, only highlighting the dominance Napoli displayed throughout the match.

As the final whistle blew, the scoreboard read 3-0, a result that reflected Napoli’s superiority in every facet of the game. The home side's tactical approach of slow build-up play perfectly countered Milan's brief counter-attack attempts. Napoli played with heart and precision, seizing every opportunity and converting them into goals, and ultimately securing three invaluable points.

This match was an illustration of what football is all about—brilliant tactics, relentless energy, and rewarding persistence. Napoli, with their comprehensive control and efficient offense, showcased the quality that makes them a formidable force in Serie A. AC Milan, despite their early setback with the red card, showed commendable fighting spirit but were ultimately outplayed and outclassed by a superior Napoli side. The night belonged to Napoli, a testament to preparedness, teamwork, and execution.
